description:
THANK GOD I FOUND THIS, it's way faster than vscode and it's open source.
I REALLY APPREACIATE THIS.

I was only able to try this for part of a day. It seemed like a perfect drop-in replacement for vscode, and it makes me happy that it's open source. Unfortunately, I need Live Share, and it's not compatible. From what I read, it sounds like Microsoft is or isn't doing something with a certificate, which is causing the problem. If they get it working, my rating will go to at least 4 stars, and quite possibly 5.
summary: Would be amazing, but not compatible with Live Share

description: I use it only for HTML, CSS, JS & MD. And it works like a charm.
summary: Works for me on Fedora33 just like VSCode

description: just got everything I want, terminal, hilight tag, flip monitor. Thanks for the devs.
Hyatımda gördüğüm enenenenenenenenenenenenenenenenenen iyi kod editörü!
This app has works flawlessly just like VS Code but without the telemetry tracking. Thank you!
Great software.
VSCodium + Code Runner = Best IDE.
Amazing! I love codium !
Worth a look.
VS Code is already open source. Stop the unnecessary fragmentation

VSCode is not open soure. If you open VSCode and go to Help > View License, you'll be redirected to a closed source license. While VSCode is largely based on open source code, the release includes many closed source components and the binary itself is closed source.

This snap, VS Codium, Is _completely_ closed source. This is similar to Google Chrome, which includes closed source components, but is based on the open source Chromium.
Really nice IDE. Works very nicely with Go

I would suggest to use VS Codium instead of VS Code, because:

* VS Codium is the clean binary from the opensource code on GitHub.
* VS Code (the Microsoft binary) contains additional telemetry code.

There are some reviews on here complaining about this causing fragmentation because VScode is already open source. While this is true, the VScode application itself has a proprietary license. It is built off of the source code and altered much as Chrome is to Chromium. VScode has an MIT license. VS Codium is the Chromium of VScode.
summary: Read if you think VScode itself is open source

description: Amazing! VS Code without MS trackers.

Developing on TX2. 
While I could get OSS-code running on the Nano, I could not get it going on the TX2 (xavier is next).

Using Jetpack 4.3
First Installed snap store on TX2, then VS Codium.
Works perfectly even with git, etc.

Maybe oss-code has some configuration issue but I couldn't get it sorted out on TX2 - but it worked OK on Nano (??)
summary: Works well on NVIDIA TX2 for development when OSS-code wouldn't

description: Compiled without MS spyware addons.

Just started using it and so far I can do the same things I used to do with Visual Code. I read a complaint about fragmentation. Functionality wise I don't see any difference at least for the things I do. And from the docs I can see that they are built from the same source code only missing the Microsoft specific added functionality. So, I think the "fragmentation" thing is nonsense. After all, isn't open source suppose to be about forking and fragmentation and seeing what works and what doesn't?
summary: Great to know there are people protecting developer's privacy

description: The idea of open extensions registry is good, but implementation is terrible. Now it's like a notepad.
This is the best alternative for VS-code. It is came with all useful extension which are already installed. So no need to install them manualy. And also it is fast.
Extensions are very less as compared to visual studio code
plugins are not working. this is the duplikate version of visual studio. Please dont install this app....
This is visual studio code but withou microsoft telementry. A true open source version that respects your privacy.
summary: Great app. It's Visual studio Code but without telementry

description: awesome app. Able to install vscode extensions, just need to download from store website

U can follow this article to export/import your extensions from original VSCode

https://dev.to/0xdonut/why-and-how-you-should-to-migrate-from-visual-studio-code-to-vscodium-j7d

Awesome to creating type or javascript projects.
I'll like this.
Sometimes got some issues with github sync but.....!!
What junk. I tried to install and it jacked up everything.
its like a full featured ide
it is vscode but in libre mode. it is great thanks
Application is fine in itself, but many extensions are missing.
summary: Don't know why, but there are no octave extensions

description:
Currently v1.56 from May, while v1.60 from September is available by adding the repo and installing with apt. Since VS Codium is updated monthly, and every version has quite some changes, being behind 4 month may be a problem for some.

For all the people complaining that they miss extensions: You need to switch to the VS Code marketplace. See here: https://github.com/VSCodium/vscodium/blob/master/DOCS.md#how-to-use-the-vs-code-marketplace
The app works well, but the stable version seems old as other comments also stated. You can get the latest version through snap by using the edge channel. (sudo snap install codium --edge --classic)
summary: Good! To get the current version use the edge channel

description: As Microsoft have no spyware in this, they deny access to the plugin market as well, in order to make it less usable. - and it works.
Nice one. Whenever there is an alternative open source one to proprietary one, I would always use the open source one.
summary: Yeah, I would recommed this app

description: I hate how microsoft literally bundled spyware just to get DA CASH but this is a much better project and i would reccomend it rather than vscode.

I love this. It's VS Code without any licensing BS, telemetry, etc. It's just VS Code as it should be. Sure, that Big Tech company might say it's free and open source, but it really isn't. This is just VS Code but much better. Finally, something that I can use that is 100% free and open source, but is also not part of M¡cr0$0f+, and something that others won't question me about.
My go to code editor on every platforms. Was using Github release for years, now trying the Snap version.
VSCodium is great and has no closed source component when compared to VSCode
summary: VSCodium is a great environment to code

description: Its best suited for linux os
Sucks when compared to Jetbrains tools but good enough when you need something for free
summary: Works same way as in Windows

description: Even two times smaller than the original
Una aplicación fantástica; es igual que VSCODE pero sin telemetría.
Funciona bien, de hecho la versión original de VScode no me va bien, esta funciona pero hay funcionalidades que se pierden.
Agradable colores, completa lo que vas escribiendo y tiene una amplia variedad de lenguaje.

Se trata de una version que no esnifa datos de usuario ni usa telemetria de VS Code. Todo es igual en usabilidad. Si vienes de otros editores como Atom, NetBeans o Eclipse puede ser que encuentres mas ligereza pero menos funcionalidad.

Hay un lio de extensiones, el desarrollador de extensiones no pone cual es el grado de privacidad y no existe la curacion. Lo mismo te encuetras 20 extensiones para css y 2 para php. 
No se, da cierta sensacion de no estar pulido
summary: Buen intento. Falta pulir muchas cosas

description: Es genial, el mundo del software libre en todo su esplendor.
Sous Debian 11 le logiciel plante aléatoirement obligeant un redémarrage complet de la machine.
summary: Logiciel super mais plante en permanence avec redémarrage obligatoire

description: Content de trouver l'application packagé, bien plus simple pour le mises à jour.
Plante moins de 15 minutes après l'avoir installé.

Sympa dans l'ensemble, et suffisant pour beaucoup de projet. Seul bémol et pas des moindres, gros gros soucis de compatibilité entre les add C# Extensions et Docker, impossible de builder une image. J'ai désinstallé Codium pour réinstaller vscode, problème réglé. Si je n'avais pas eut ce soucis je l'aurais conservé vonlontiers. Je n'enlève qu'une seule étoile car il s'agit d'un problème spécifique dont j'ignore totalement la cause.
Je code en C# pour le moteur Godot et ça fonctionne !
summary: je recommande avec l'éditeur du moteur Godot

description: Возникли проблемы с vs code, перешел на codium. Пока все нормально.
Очень удобно и в отличии от VS-code никакого говна от microsoft
не работает должным образом
summary: крашится при попытке открыть файл с программным кодом
